result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Patrick A. Lockart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
DPA Hearing on Count 1 - 6/3/16 @ 8:30am.

records.addlTxt: Amended Info
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Count 2.
Stipulated Hold Open Agreement - 12 months on Count 1.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Patrick A. Lockart, appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Clerk: PT
Amended Information filed by the State and case is resolved.  
Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; judgment is withheld and parties enter into a Stipulated Hold Open Agreement for 1 year.  
Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  Appeal Rights given.
DPA Hearing on 6/3/16 at 8:30 AM.  Bond continues.

NO RECORD TAKEN:  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Attorney Hilary D. Edwards appeared. Clerk: PT
Case remains on trial calendar and may be a plea.
9/22/14 - Motion to Suppress

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA E Trigg
Scheduling Order

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Patrick A. Lockart, appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Clerk: PT
Atty Edwards states restitution is not solidified at this time so case is not resolved.  Scheduling Order is given to parties.  Jury Status on 5/21/15 at 1:00 PM; Jury Trial on 5/26/15 at 8:30 AM.

Attorney Margaret Drees and Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State. Defendant, Patrick A. Lockart, appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Clerk: PT
No brief was filed by the State, which was due by 10/27/14.  State's motion to dismiss is denied.  Court orders sanctions against the DA's Office in the amount of $100 since no good cause was shown by ADA Drees or ADA Hinshaw for failing to file the brief.  Court also renders decision denying Atty Edward's motion to suppress for reasons set forth on the record.  Atty Edwards requests an adjournment to obtain a formal offer from the State.  Court grants one final adjournment.  FPT on 1/23/15 at 10:20 AM.
received from Atty Edwards
Decision on December 17, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Due to courts unavailability in the afternoon on 12/17/14; Decision moved to 12/17/14 at 11:00 AM per confirmation from Atty Edwards
09-22-14 Motion Hearing
Exhibit 1.    Exhibit 1 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 05-28-15 - jt

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Patrick A. Lockart, appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Clerk: PT
Atty Edwards states she has been waiting for reports from Joint Services.  Testimony taken from KSD Deputy John Lanctot.  Exhibit 1 offered and received.  Atty Edwards states would like to supplement the record with those reports.  Court instructs Atty Edwards to provide notice to both the court and ADA Trigg by 10/6/14 if she will be supplementing the record.  ADA Trigg to filed a brief by 10/27/14 and Atty Edwards will have until 11/17/14 to file her reply brief.  Decision on 12/17/14 at 2:30 PM.
Motion hearing on September 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
